description.narrative: Strengthening Capacity and thought leadership and enable the government to review and deliver on its set targets for Egyptian Vision 2030 (SDS) and the SDGs

activity-description.narrative: Area of work A: Strengthening Capacity and thought leadership ($205,000). The National Committee is composed of 16 entities, including MoPMAR which acts as its rapporteur and the main interlocutor with bilateral, multilateral agencies, including the United Nations.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Themes and policy dialogues/discussions timeline will be identified in partnership with MoPMAR * # National policies reviewed and mapped with reference to SDG targets & SDS reviewed targets/ indicators *#Analysis reports on process produced (national SDS and SDGs) *#Sectoral analysis relevant to UNDP (Goal 1 Goal 6, 10 and Goal 16) are identified and produced * Series of 10 policy dialogue discussions initiated with Multi stakeholder (Number of policy dialogues, attendants, format, location to be identified be developed) * Undertaking DFA to inform financing & resource mobilization efforts

comment.narrative: - National SDS indicator baseline is available - A number of national strategies adopted and implemented - Financing assessment conducted for the SDGs

- Knowledge tools on SDG mainstreaming developed and disseminated - International Futures Partnership renewed and new research areas on SDG forecasting are developed 2019 Target - National M&E system established to track National strategy and SDGs - Completion of the Development Finance Assessment for both Social Protection and gender

- MAPS engagement brought to completion with report and 2 closing round tables, at technical level in July and at the Ministerial level in October 2019 - “SDG Report: Egypt 2030” and Policy Note on SDG Accelerators finalized, translated and published - 5 days capacity strengthening workshop on using the International Futures model for 25 government participants (of which 14 women) from 12 different Egyptian institutions, with follow up support - Follow up to finalize research papers that can be used for policy setting. - supported consultations and strengthened GoE capacity to update and review national strategy (SDS) to better align to SDGs and with a strong M&E framework and measurement system
- Development Financing Assessment started with draft of the Landscape DFA chapter under review, focus on financing of social protection with a gender lens will be implemented in January and February 2020 - Follow up policy support engagement being designed

- Completion of Knowledge tools on SDG mainstreaming being ready and disseminated - International Futures Partnership renewed and providing more depth on the analysis and research areas on SDG forecasting - Supporting the update of National strategy and National M&E system under review to track National strategy indicators and SDGs - Completion of the Development Finance Assessment for general landscape - International Futures Partnership renewed and new research areas on SDG forecasting are developed, Capacity building for government officials and think tanks on International Futures forecasting

- UNDP is supporting Ministry of Planning and Economic Development role to coordinate the works of the national SDG Committee, ensure the Committee concretely integrates both agenda – Egypt SDS and Agenda 2030/SDG, through knowledge products and sector. National M&E system under review to track National strategy and SDGs policy analysis.
“SDG Report: Egypt 2030” and Policy Note on SDG Accelerators finalized, translated and published
Supporting MPED and other institutions to use the long-term forecasting tool ‘International Futures’ to refine policy recommendations. This contributes to the analytical framework for GoE’s SDG prioritization, and will enable decision makers to make informed choice on potential SDG accelerators for Egypt. In addition to the support for the national statistics institution in Egypt (CAPMAS) in strengthening their statistical capacity by participating with a technical paper on the 62nd ISI World Statistics Congress 2019
Focusing one of the scenarios from International Futures forecasting on women empowerment, and results was a deep dive for women empowerment scenario as an integrator for SDGs, still under review with MPED policy team.
- Development Financing Assessment started with draft of the Landscape DFA chapter under review, and focusing on financing tools as a building block for Integrated National Financing Framework
- Follow up policy support engagement being designed
